citation.article-title: Caldimicrobium rimae gen. nov., sp. nov., an extremely thermophilic, facultatively lithoautotrophic, anaerobic bacterium from the Uzon Caldera, Kamchatka.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Caldimicrobium (Cal.di.mi.cro′bi.um. L. adj. caldus hot; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Caldimicrobium microbe living in hot places).
Cells are Gram-negative, oval rods, about 1.0–1.2 μm long and 0.5 μm wide, with two polar flagella.
Able to grow chemolithoautotrophically with molecular hydrogen in the presence of thiosulfate or elemental sulfur with formation of H2S.
Able to utilize organic acids and alcohols in the presence of the same electron acceptors.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 35.2 mol%.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis places the genus in the family Thermodesulfobacteriaceae.
The type species is Caldimicrobium rimae.
